titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Time Inc. Bio Files MS 3009.RG2
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Holly Deakyne, Samantha Brown, and Melanie Rinehart
titlestmt.sponsor: The processing of the Time Inc. Records was made possible by a generous grant from the Henry Luce Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-12-15T12:44-0500

did.abstract: The Time Inc. Bio Files document the careers of Time Inc. staff, non-staff closely associated with the company, and notable figures. This record group also includes the collection’s primary files on cofounder Briton Hadden.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The Time Inc. Bio Files were assembled and maintained by the Time Inc. Archives and predominately document the careers of Time Inc. staff from board members (H. P. Davison) and company executives (John S. Martin, Ray Cave, Hedley Donovan, Elizabeth Valk Long) to administrative assistants. The files represent staff from all divisions, departments and subsidiaries including Time, Life, Fortune, Sports Illustrated, Architectural Forum, March of Time, Time-Life Books, Time-Life Films, Time-Life International, Home Box Office, Little, Brown and Company, and Inland Container Company.

Time Inc. also kept files on non-staff closely associated with the company such as contracted writers, topical advisors, subjects of articles, and some family and former classmates of cofounders Henry R. Luce and Briton Hadden in relation to interviews during various history and biography projects. Furthermore, the files include artists, architects, and historical figures due to additions of files during a reorganization of the libraries and archives after the Time Warner and AOL merger.
Time Inc. housed Bio Files on especially important historical figures or staff files of significance separately in a safe. This includes the collection’s primary files on cofounder Hadden.

Contents consist of correspondence; memoranda regarding new hires, departing staff and other staffing changes; press releases; news clippings including obituaries; articles from the staff newsletters, primarily F.Y.I.; articles or correspondent cables by or about staff; reports and comments on articles and books under consideration for publication; invitations to events; and speeches or other public remarks. Photographs and other photographic material, and audiovisual recordings of interviews, oral histories, and public speeches are present infrequently.

Of note are interview transcripts of staff reminiscences from the Time Inc. history project undertaken by Celia Sugarman and Alex Groner in the 1950s and 1960s. Time cover artist files such as Boris Artzybasheff and William Oberhardt may contain original sketches and other artwork. Most folders that contain correspondence from cofounder Luce are stamped “H. R. Luce.” Copies of pre-1933 memoranda and correspondence from Luce occasionally occur throughout the Bio Files. Empty folders are retained and noted.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation Note
prefercite.p: This record group should be cited as Time Inc. Bio Files (MS 3009.RG2), The New-York Historical Society.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open to qualified researchers with the exception of restricted materials. Restricted materials may include privileged attorney correspondence; student records; medical records; personnel performance evaluations; contracts and agreements; and records with personally identifiable information. Restricted materials are located in boxes R1 to R3.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: This collection is owned by the New-York Historical Society. Although the N-YHS owns this collection as physical property, the donor specifically retains all copyright and all other proprietary rights which may exist. The copyright law of the United States governs the making of photocopies and protects unpublished materials as well as published materials. Unpublished materials created before January 1, 1978 cannot be quoted in publication without permission of the copyright holder.

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: The Bio Files were processed in 2016 by Holly Deakyne and Melanie Rinehart. The original folders were retained although some documents were transferred to archival containers in instances of overcrowding. Rinehart and Samantha Brown created the inventory, and Deakyne created other descriptive notes to produce this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials Note
relatedmaterial.p: This finding aid relates to just one record group of the Time Inc. Records. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the Time Inc. Records (MS 3009). The Henry Luce Papers (MS 3014) were acquired with the Time Inc. records. These papers include Luce's name files and may duplicate people represented in the Bio Files. The collection of books acquired with the records are cataloged as the Time Inc. Reference Library.

scopecontent.p: Original member of the Board of Directors, his files contain: corporate records from 1925 to 1933 including bylaws, stockholder and board meeting reports, treasurer and president reports, budgets, and business letters signed by Briton Hadden; early opinions of Time; and the first issues of Tide.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: World War II Supreme Commander of the Allied Forces in Europe, first Supreme Commander of NATO, and U.S. President from 1953 until 1961. Contains extensive correspondence from him between 1944 and 1966 including a letter praising the Life P.G.A. golf film and snapshots of him on board the presidential aircraft Columbine.

scopecontent.p: Eight folders with "H.R. Luce" stamp. Besides being Luce's personal aide, Grover served in the U.S. Office of Facts and Figures during World War II. His files contain extensive correspondence and memoranda.
Includes 1 audiotape reel : analog, 7 in., 1/4 in. tape. Labeled "MAG's Speech at staff meeting - year ? early 70's".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Cofounder of Time Inc. Includes his original childhood and college letters to his mother and extensive original and reproduced photographs. Also includes facsimiles of letter regarding the plan to found Time Inc. and condolences upon his death. Box 338 contains copies only.

1 audiocassette : analog. Case is labeled "Heiskell at Fortune Sales Meeting, 1976" and cassette is labeled "The Great Company Today and Tomorrow, Andrew Heiskell"

1 audiotape reel : analog, 7 1/2 ips; 7 in. Case marked "Speech by Andrew Heiskell, after staff presentation, March 28, 1968, a.m" "Speech is preceded by: 1) 4 sec. of applaus 2)5 sec. silence, then speech"

1 audiotape reel : analog, 3 3/4 ips; 5 in. In a manilla envelope, marked "Vivistiles A Heiskell 34," with a note attached. The note indicates the contents of the tape, the running time, the speed to play reel, and a summary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Six folders, One folder has a "H.R. Luce" stamp and one folder has A/V material.
1/4 in. tape. Includes a note:

"Bob: This tape contains mainly our 'preface'. It contains matter not in the nature of editing and perhaps enlarging on the original but matter which we could not resist articulating. We taped only one ride or we were not too familiar with the wollen-rak. Now we're going to use a Noreleo which is simpler. We want to get this tape off to you to let you know we have our project under way. Will have more tape on the way shortly.
Bill Wilson
P.S.-You'll find the first few feet of this tape a litte indistinct, but it picks up agter a moment or two.
Bill Howland Willson Hicks"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Larsen was one of the first employees of Time Inc. His files contain extensive memoranda and correspondence beginning in the 1930s on topics such as his interview with Mussolini and a meeting with the Post Office Solicitor regarding nudes in Life. Also included are:

1 audiotape reel : analog, 1 7/8 ips; 5 in., 1/4 in. tape. Case is marked, "July 13 '65; Conversation with Ray Larsen & R.T. Elson; Le manuscript #1; Recordreel at 1 7/8"; transcribed - 11/12/65- C Sugarman"
1 audiotape reel : analog, 3 3/4 ips; 7 in., 1/4 in. tape. Contains 1 track that was recorded on 8/28/56. Track runs 1 hour. Additionally dated 10/29/56.

1 audiotape reel : analog, 3 3/4 ips; 7 in., 1/4 in. tape. Contains 2 tracks that were recorded on 7/29/57. Playing time of 1.5 hours and additionally marked 8/22/57 co. Case is marked "Larsen, R.E. - Reminiscences Tapes 7/29/57".
1 audiotape reel : analog, 3 3/4 ips; 7 in., 1/4 in. tape. Contains 1 track which was recorded on 7/22/57. Playing time is 1 hour. Additionally marked 8/13/57.
1 audiotape reel : analog, 3 3/4 ips; 7 in., 1/4 in. tape. Contains 1 track which was recorded on 7/3/57. Additinally marked 8/9/57 cx.

scopecontent.p: U.S. Senator from 1935 to 1945, Vice President in 1945, and U.S. President from 1945 to 1953. Contains correspondence from him between 1939 and 1965 including discussion of the MacArthur controversy. Some materials are photocopies.
